author: jennifercobbe.bsky.social
text: (If you run faster trains and slower trains on the same track, the slower trains get in the way of the faster trains - so you need to limit the number of *both* faster and slower trains to make it work. Separate them out and you can run many, many more of each than you otherwise could. That's HS2!)

text: But a big part of the capacity problem is that trying to run faster longer-distance trains on the same track as slower local/regional trains just restricts both. A timely reminder of the state of NHS infrastructure before the government's review of the "new hospital programme" (reminder: not all are hospitals!) is published.

I'm currently expecting this to be published tomorrow.

text: No. Labour to phase in new hospital building programme after Tory failure to fund any of it.

text:

text:
The town was promised a new hospital in 2020 as part of the Conservative government‚Äôs New Hospital Programme.
